title.narrative: Strengthen Coffee Producers` Organizational and Technical Capacity to Improve Their Income and Increase Employment Opportunities for Their Children in Southern Loja.. Strengthen Coffee Producers' Organizational and Technical Capacity to Improve Their Income and Increase Employment Opportunities for Their Children in Southern Loja

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award In coordination with Asociación Agroartesanal de Productores Ecológicos de Café Especial del Cantón Loja (APECAEL) Fundación para Conservación y Desarrollo Colinas Verdes (Colinas Verdes) will work with 720 coffee farmers to undertake an integrated progr. In coordination with Asociación Agroartesanal de Productores Ecológicos de Café Especial del Cantón Loja (APECAEL), Fundación para Conservación y Desarrollo Colinas Verdes (Colinas Verdes) will work with 720 coffee farmers to undertake an integrated progr. In coordination with Asociación Agroartesanal de Productores Ecológicos de Café Especial del Cantón Loja (APECAEL) Fundación para Conservación y Desarrollo Colinas Verdes (Colinas Verdes) will work with 720 coffee farmers to undertake an integrated program of pest management; plant trees to diversify food and cash crops; and encourage young people to work on family farms. An additional 3000 residents of Vilcabamba Loja in southern Ecuador will also benefit..

description.narrative: In response to restrictions imposed by the Ecuadorian government, USAID closed its mission on September 30, 2014. Additionally, International Military Education and Training (IMET) and Foreign Military Financing (FMF) assistance halted and remaining funds were reallocated when the Ecuadorian government terminated bilateral military cooperation and asked the U.S. Embassy to end military cooperation operations by April 30, 2014. The United States will continue to promote the development of sustainable institutions and processes in Ecuador for democracy, human rights, and the rule of law. U.S. assistance will support civil society and freedom of expression in Ecuador.
Disbursement of funds to the Award Implementing Organization to carry out the activities set forth in Annex A of the grant agreement.
